title: Olympidata
text:
Preface
Add introduction to your project here.

title: Report
text:
2. Methodology

2.1 Data Cleaning and Preparation

Removed missing values in key attributes such as age, height, weight, and medals.
Filtered data
Created new variables:

medal_won: Indicates if an athlete won a medal (Yes/No).
repeat_participation: Captures repeated appearances by athletes.




2.2 Analysis Approach

Physical Attributes: Compared average age, height, and weight of medalists vs non-medalists.
Experience: Evaluated the role of age and repeated participation in medal success.
Country Dominance: Analyzed which countries are top performers in each sport.
Sport Comparisons: Highlighted differences and similarities between sports

title: Report
text:
3. Results

3.1 Medal Performance by Physical Attributes

Findings:
Visualization:




3.2 Impact of Experience

Findings:
Visualization:

title: Report
text:
6. Recommendations

For Athletes: Tailor training regimens based on the physical and experiential needs of each sport.
For Countries: Invest in infrastructure and coaching programs to support elite-level performance.
For Further Analysis: Integrate data on training, funding, and external conditions to refine predictive models for success.


Would you like me to help draft specific sections or generate sample visualizations for inclusion in this report?

title: Proposal
text:
title: Olympidata
Team members: Avery Sheindlin, Jack Fang, Han Sun，Khaleesi Chen
We are examining different olympic sports, and investigating which traits excel in those specific sports. The olympics is one of the biggest global events in the world. We were interested in this topic because there is so much to examine when it comes to the participants within the olympics.
Responsibility plan:
Each member will be in charge of examining data for 2 different sports. And then we will come together at the end to compare and contrast our factors.

title: Appendix B — A tibble: 2,486 × 15
text:
olympics <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-08-06/olympics.csv')

Rows: 271116 Columns: 15
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (10): name, sex, team, noc, games, season, city, sport, event, medal
dbl  (5): id, age, height, weight, year

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
swimming <- olympics %>%
  filter(sport == "Swimming")%>%
  drop_na()
swimming

      id name     sex     age height weight team  noc   games  year season city 
   <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <chr>

 2   460 "Viktor… M        22    190     78 Sovi… URS   1972…  1972 Summer Muni…
 3   460 "Viktor… M        22    190     78 Sovi… URS   1972…  1972 Summer Muni…
 4   465 "Matthe… M        30    197     92 Aust… AUS   2016…  2016 Summer Rio …
 5   509 "Gary A… M        21    175     64 Grea… GBR   1980…  1980 Summer Mosk…

10  1017 "Nathan… M        19    198    100 Unit… USA   2008…  2008 Summer Beij…
# ℹ 2,476 more rows
# ℹ 3 more variables: sport <chr>, event <chr>, medal <chr>



ggplot(swimming, aes(x = team))+
  geom_bar()









swimming_year <- swimming%>%
  group_by(year)%>%
  summarize(avg_h = mean(height),
         avg_w = mean(weight),
         avg_a = mean(age))
ggplot(swimming_year, aes(x = year, y = avg_h))+
  geom_point()







ggplot(swimming_year, aes(x = year, y = avg_w))+
  geom_point()







ggplot(swimming_year, aes(x = year, y = avg_a))+
  geom_point()









swimming_event <- swimming %>%
  group_by(event)%>%
  summarize(avg_h = mean(height),
            avg_w = mean(weight),
            avg_a = mean(age),
            count = n())%>%
  slice_max(count, n=10)
ggplot(swimming, aes(x = event))+
  geom_bar()







ggplot(swimming_event, aes(x = event, y = avg_h))+
  geom_point()







ggplot(swimming_event, aes(x = event, y = avg_w))+
  geom_point()







ggplot(swimming_event, aes(x = event, y = avg_a))+
  geom_point()

title: Appendix C — Cross Country Skiing & Alpine Skiing
text:
D Top Countries by Participation
top_countries <- olympics |>
  filter(sport %in% c("Cross Country Skiing", "Alpine Skiing")) |>
  group_by(noc, sport) |>
  summarize(participation = n(), .groups = 'drop') |>
  arrange(desc(participation))
top_countries

# A tibble: 182 × 3
   noc   sport                participation
   <chr> <chr>                        <int>
 1 SWE   Cross Country Skiing           596
 2 FIN   Cross Country Skiing           590
 3 NOR   Cross Country Skiing           578
 4 AUT   Alpine Skiing                  556
 5 USA   Alpine Skiing                  552
 6 USA   Cross Country Skiing           538
 7 ITA   Cross Country Skiing           528
 8 SUI   Alpine Skiing                  520
 9 ITA   Alpine Skiing                  498
10 FRA   Alpine Skiing                  476
# ℹ 172 more rows
top_countries |>
  slice_max(participation, n = 10) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(noc, participation), y = participation, fill = sport)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "Top 10 Countries by Participation in Skiing Sports",
    x = "Country (NOC)",
    y = "Number of Athletes",
    fill = "Sport"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
crumbs: C  Cross Country Skiing & Alpine Skiing

title: Appendix C — Cross Country Skiing & Alpine Skiing
section: G.1 Correlation Between Medal Wins and Physical Attributes
text:
G.1 Correlation Between Medal Wins and Physical Attributes

medal_correlation <- olympics |>
  filter(sport %in% c("Cross Country Skiing", "Alpine Skiing")) |>
  mutate(medal_won = ifelse(is.na(medal), "No", "Yes")) |>
  group_by(sport, medal_won) |>
  summarize(
    avg_age = mean(age, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_height = mean(height, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_weight = mean(weight, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = 'drop'
  )
medal_correlation

# A tibble: 4 × 5
  sport                medal_won avg_age avg_height avg_weight
  <chr>                <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>
1 Alpine Skiing        No           23.1       173.       72.0
2 Alpine Skiing        Yes          24.3       174.       72.8
3 Cross Country Skiing No           25.9       173.       65.9
4 Cross Country Skiing Yes          27.6       173.       65.8

# Visualize the trends
medal_correlation |>
  pivot_longer(cols = c(avg_age, avg_height, avg_weight), names_to = "attribute", values_to = "value") |>
  ggplot(aes(x = sport, y = value, fill = medal_won)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  facet_wrap(~attribute, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(
    title = "Physical Attributes of Medal Winners vs Non-Medalists",
    x = "Sport",
    y = "Average Value",
    fill = "Medal Won"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()








##Trends Between Cross Country and Alpine Skiing

skiing_comparison <- olympics |>
  filter(sport %in% c("Cross Country Skiing", "Alpine Skiing")) |>
  group_by(sport) |>
  summarize(
    avg_age = mean(age, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_height = mean(height, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_weight = mean(weight, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_medals = sum(!is.na(medal)),
    .groups = 'drop'
  )
skiing_comparison

# A tibble: 2 × 5
  sport                avg_age avg_height avg_weight total_medals
  <chr>                  <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>        <int>
1 Alpine Skiing           23.2       173.       72.1          428
2 Cross Country Skiing    26.0       173.       65.9          776

# Visualize Skiing Comparison
skiing_comparison |>
  pivot_longer(cols = c(avg_age, avg_height, avg_weight, total_medals), names_to = "attribute", values_to = "value") |>
  ggplot(aes(x = sport, y = value, fill = sport)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  facet_wrap(~attribute, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(
    title = "Comparison of Cross Country vs Alpine Skiing",
    x = "Sport",
    y = "Average Value",
    fill = "Sport"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
crumbs: C  Cross Country Skiing & Alpine Skiing

title: Appendix D — Figure-Skating & Speed-Skating
text:
E Data & Library
olympics <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-08-06/olympics.csv')

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(gt)

title: Appendix D — Figure-Skating & Speed-Skating
text:
F.1 Filter by Sport

figure <- olympics %>%
  filter(sport == "Figure Skating")%>%
  drop_na()
figure

title: Appendix D — Figure-Skating & Speed-Skating
text:
F.2 Seperate by Sex

figure_M <- figure %>%
  filter(sex == "M")
figure_F <- figure %>%
  filter(sex == "F")

speed_M <- speed %>%
  filter(sex == "M")
speed_F <- speed %>%
  filter(sex == "F")
